title: SYSTEM$SHOW_ACTIVE_BEHAVIOR_CHANGE_BUNDLES | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
Returns an array of the currently available behavior change release bundles, the default
state of each bundle, and the actual state of the bundle for the current account.

Returns a VARCHAR value that contains an array of objects that represent the currently available behavior change bundles.
Each object contains the following keys, which describe the status of the bundle:
Name of the behavior change bundle
true if the associated bundle should be enabled by default for the current account; false otherwise.
true if the associated bundle is actually enabled by default for the current account; false otherwise.

Calling SYSTEM$ENABLE_BEHAVIOR_CHANGE_BUNDLE or SYSTEM$DISABLE_BEHAVIOR_CHANGE_BUNDLE changes the value of
isEnabled for the specified bundle.

SYSTEM$BEHAVIOR_CHANGE_BUNDLE_STATUS returns the same information as this function for a
specific bundle.
The following example returns information about the current behavior change bundles.

The following example uses the PARSE_JSON function to return the array as a VARIANT and then uses the FLATTEN
function to present the bundle information in a tabular format.
